children.subject:
Not OP, but I have a question about how time conflicts work.

61b does not allow time conflicts, my other EE class with discussion at the same time does (@10490)

According to https://sis.berkeley.edu/help/enrollment-faq/time-conflict, if one class does allow time conflict, the system should allow registration. However, when I try to enroll, it says "The requested class is set to not allow any students to enroll in classes with time conflicts" as an error without a "Yes" button.

Does anyone know why this is occurring? (I currently don't have the units to enroll anyways and was just validating for later, perhaps that is why the button isn't showing up?)

history.content:
Update for you all:

I spoke with Prof Hilfinger earlier this week and we have been working to resolve this issue and I believe we now have.

Just to clarify - time conflicts with the LECTURE for CS 61B are still not allowed. We have now changed the system settings so that a time conflict with the 999 sections for CS 61B do not cause error messages or enrollment issues. 

In response to the question about how time conflicts work - if you enroll into the class that doesn't allow time conflicts FIRST and then enroll into the class that allows time conflicts, you can then be enrolled in both. HOWEVER - faculty are under NO obligation to offer alternate exams so be sure faculty approve your plan. Just because there's a way to do it in CalCentral does NOT mean it's okay with faculty!

children.subject: Yeah but multiple classes use the same time for the 999 section, so if you enroll in two classes with 999 sections they would conflict (see @11111)
In response to the instructors' answer, I'm a bit confused as to how there can even be time conflict with the 999 section? Those sections are scheduled for 1 minute at midnight on Sunday?

I can't see CalCentral but classes.berkeley.edu (the official listing for the class) says that it does not. Perhaps you're seeing that time conflicts with the lab & discussion sections are okay? I can tell you definitively that time conflicts with the lecture will NOT be allowed by Prof Hilfinger.
Just wondering, but if 61B doesn't allow for time conflicts, why does CalCentral say that it does?

history.content:
After communicating with the CS advisor, I was suggested to email the Prof. Hilfinger about my situation. (Since the course that CS61B conflicts with does not have a final exam, there is no final conflict issue, so the situation is fairly simple).

However, I'm afraid that my email (along with a few other reminders) has been buried under the many emails he may receive. It is adjustment period already and CS61B is filling up fast. Is there any other way to have my request delivered?
history.subject: CS 61B Time Conflict Restriction Exception
